nodes.bodyText:
Nit: Should we use lazy logging to avoid string concat? -- i.e.
LOG.warn("Unable to create Cruise Control metrics topic {}.", _cruiseControlMetricsTopic, e);

We have some common logic regarding (1) creating non-existing topic and (2) modifying the selected configs of existing topics (i.e. here and in sample store topic creation).
Can we make the relevant logic (1) shared and (2) pluggable between the two? The first part will ensure a common code path for similar execution. The second part will enable users to add their custom logic that they may want to automate during topic creation (e.g. generating ACLs).

I was thinking about this.
One concern prevent me doing that is where should I put the common code. Because cruise-control and cruise-control-metrics-reporter are two separate module and we do not want one to depends on the other. And it also seems inappropriate to put this code in cruise-control-core module since it only contains non-kafka-specific code.

Sure, I agree with your concerns regarding sharing the logic.
Are there any issues with making each logic pluggable within their corresponding modules?

While I was taking a deeper look, I just realize that CruiseControlMetricsReporter and KafkaSampleStore themselves are Configurable class, then to make the topic management logic pluggable, we can simply change corresponding methods to protected.
For example, if someone want to add some more check for metrics topic, (s)he can directly extends from CruiseControlMetricsReporter and override createNewTopicFromReporterConfig(), createCruiseControlMetricsTopic() and maybeUpdateCruiseControlMetricsTopic() methods.
and then change the config metric.reporters to the extended class name.
Nit: Can we avoid hard coding 5000?
(Applies to topic creation code path) Missing modification regarding cleanup policy and retention (please see KafkaSampleStore#ensureTopicCreated).
Should it be equals(...) or !equals(...)?
This and the following if statements seem to be good candidates to move to a util function, which adds a config to the given set if it satisfies certain criteria.
This and the preceding try-catch blocks seem to perform independent operations -- would it possible to move them to their own functions?
I don't think this should be configurable -- i.e. we do not support any other configuration, let's avoid exposing it.

Nit-1: The description is missing the unit of the retention time.
Nit-2: Missing dot at the end.
Can we (1) make it static? ... -> protected static void maybeUpdateConfig and (2) move it to CruiseControlMetricsUtils with a JavaDoc?
Can we add a unit test to verify that this function works as expected?
I find writing a unit test for this method is pretty hard given it is a broker dependency, I would like to verify this in deployment.
Can we use CCKafkaClientsIntegrationTestHarness to handle broker dependency?
Added test.

Nit: Would it be possible to make this and the other DEFAULT_* static final variables public? This allows users to access these defaults in other pluggable implementations of metrics reporter in case of need.

This call to listTopics() introduces an additional network roundtrip in case the topic does not exist.
Wouldn't it be more efficient to attempt to create the topic and handle TopicExistsException? If the topic exists, then we can update it.
Maybe more importantly, if the topic is created after the topic list is retrieved here, the call to create topic will fail with TopicExistsException and the code won't be able to handle it.
Is it possible to make this static and move it to CruiseControlMetricsUtils with a JavaDoc?
I feel the content of this method is specific to metric topic, I would like to keep it in this class.
Nit: Can we use {} rather than string concat?

For describeConfigsResult and alterConfigsResult, we seem to be blocking indefinitely.
Can we add timeouts to relevant get calls to avoid potential deadlock?
Would it be possible to combine configName and targetConfigValue in a Map? This allows getting response from this util function in one call.

nodes.bodyText: Do we need to verify that the exception is a TopicExistsException and not due to another reason?
In the test I found that TopicExistsException will not be directly thrown out here, it will be wrapped by an ExecutionException. That's why we do not explicitly handle TopicExistsException.

Isn't the ExecutionException thrown by the call to get for the future?
TopicExistsException seems to be stored in CreateTopicsResponse  (i.e. please see CreateTopicsRequest#getErrorResponse), which is handled in KafkaAdminClient#createTopics -> handleResponse. This completes the future exceptionally.
Not sure why we need a cast here.
